publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3605 Christine Grahame: Scottish Produce in the Scottish Parliament—That the Parliament notes the success of Scottish Food Fortnight and celebrates the quality food produced Scotland-wide; regrets that the members’ dining room in Holyrood, which plays host to many guests across Scotland and internationally, rarely features home produce, and therefore calls on the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body to take appropriate measures to ensure that the dining room becomes a showcase for Scottish produce featuring regions of Scotland on a rotational basis. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S2M-3605 Scottish Produce in the Scottish Parliament (lodged on 21 November 2005) Michael Matheson*, Ms Sandra White*, Robin Harper*, Eleanor Scott*, Brian Adam*, Patrick Harvie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-3605 Scottish Produce in the Scottish Parliament (lodged on 21 November 2005) Fergus Ewing*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Stewart Stevenson*
S2M-3605 Scottish Produce in the Scottish Parliament (lodged on 21 November 2005) Mr Brian Monteith*

S2M-3605 Christine Grahame: Scottish Produce in the Scottish Parliament—That the Parliament notes the success of Scottish Food Fortnight and celebrates the quality food produced Scotland-wide; regrets that the members’ dining room in Holyrood, which plays host to many guests across Scotland and internationally, rarely features home produce, and therefore calls on the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body to take appropriate measures to ensure that the dining room becomes a showcase for Scottish produce featuring regions of Scotland on a rotational basis. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Ms Sandra White, Robin Harper, Eleanor Scott, Brian Adam, Patrick Harvie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Mr Jamie Stone, Fergus Ewing, Richard Lochhead, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Stewart Stevenson, Mr Brian Monteith
S2M-3605 Scottish Produce in the Scottish Parliament (lodged on 21 November 2005) Shiona Baird*
S2M-3605 Scottish Produce in the Scottish Parliament (lodged on 21 November 2005) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3605 Scottish Produce in the Scottish Parliament (lodged on 21 November 2005) Mr Bruce McFee*
S2M-3605 Scottish Produce in the Scottish Parliament (lodged on 21 November 2005) John Swinburne*
S2M-3605 Scottish Produce in the Scottish Parliament (lodged on 21 November 2005) Phil Gallie*
